definition: to sculpt/to carve (jade)/ornate artwork/overly elaborate prose

sentences.english: We are like jewels, shaped with the hammer and chisel of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有如宝石，需要经过苦难的锤凿来雕琢。

sentences.english: Away to the west gate formation is purely natural, non-labor carved.
sentences.chinese: 西天门纯粹是自然形成，非人工雕琢而成。

sentences.english: The skill with which he faceted the great diamond is remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 他在大颗钻石上雕琢小平面的技巧是不同凡响的。

sentences.english: I firmly believe that every child is a jade to be polished.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信，每个孩子都是一块待雕琢的美玉。

sentences.english: Laotse, "The Old Boy, " always emphasized in his Taotehching the unearned rock.
sentences.chinese: 老子在他的《道德经》里始终看重不雕琢的石头。

sentences.english: You head carve pattern longevity, you handle inlaid auspicious cloud the mast.
sentences.chinese: 如意头雕琢福寿图纹，如意柄尾镶嵌吉祥云纹黄杨木。

sentences.english: Jin is carved or cast in bronze containers language.
sentences.chinese: 金文是雕琢或锻造在青铜器皿上的文字。

sentences.english: Here, nature’s fingers have sculpted intricate jewels that jut dramatically from the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 群岛彷佛是大自然在太平洋上雕琢出来的珠宝。

sentences.english: Just Cause 2 also lacks polish in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 《正当防卫2》中的部分内容同样缺乏雕琢。

sentences.english: I think the new employer is a rough diamond.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得那个新雇员是一块未经雕琢的美玉。

sentences.english: I think that new singer is a diamond in the rough.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得那个新歌手是块未经雕琢的玉。

sentences.english: The sculptor was at work chiseling a statue.
sentences.chinese: 雕塑家正在雕琢一尊雕像。

sentences.english: It took a lot of effort to learn how to carve needles out of bone.
sentences.chinese: 学习如何把骨头雕琢成针，得付出大量努力。

sentences.english: When an artist starts to create a sculpture, he has to keep chipping away.
sentences.chinese: 当一个艺术家开始创作雕像时，他必须反复雕琢。

sentences.english: It was a sculpted and painted bar of soap. “Soap?
sentences.chinese: 其实那是一块经过雕琢并描色的肥皂。

definition: lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
supernaturally fine craft (idiom); the work of the Gods/uncanny workmanship/superlative craftsmanship
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
lit. to pile up (bricks)/to pack/fig. to pad out (writing with fancy phrases)/ornate rhetoric
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
